de.ibm.com.opentm2scripteride.gui.custom
Class FileTree

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              javax.swing.JTree
                  de.ibm.com.opentm2scripteride.gui.custom.FileTree
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.Scrollable
public class FileTree
extends javax.swing.JTree

A dynamically changing JTree, which shows the FileSystem under the "root" path

See Also:
Serialized Form

Nested Class Summary
protected  class FileTree.FileCellRenderer
          Adds some better looking icons.
protected  class FileTree.FileTreeListener
          Mouse listener that either selects or opens the document on double-click (depending on its type) and opens the context menu on right-click
 class FileTree.FileTreeModel
          The TreeModel for the FileTree some methods are already been filled in the AbstractTreeModel

Constructor Detail

FileTree

public FileTree(java.lang.String root,
                int type)
Creates a new FileTree and adds a MouseListener for double click events and a TransferHandler for DnD Events, only dragging is supported

Parameters:
root - The root dir, from which the file system should be listed
Method Detail

createContextMenu

protected void createContextMenu()
Creates the context menu for the FileTree The context menu has two items: One to rename a file/directoy, the other one to delete it

Returns the absolute selection path, because JTree isn't able to show it

the Absolute Path for the current selection
